definition: to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
timely handling doubles the effect and halves the effort/the right approach saves effort and leads to better results/a stitch in time saves nine
pinyin: ji2 shi2 chu3 li3 , shi4 ban4 gong1 bei4

sentences.english: These are common issues to be handled, but it's critical to handle them in a timely manner.
sentences.chinese: 这些都是需要处理的常见问题，但必须及时处理它们。

sentences.english: Cardia complications must be seriously detected during hemodialysis and be treated with in time.
sentences.chinese: 血透中必须密切观察心血管疾病发生，并及时处理。

sentences.english: This method is timelier than the polling method and guarantees that the response is handled immediately.
sentences.chinese: 回调方法比轮询方法更及时，能确保响应被及时处理。

sentences.english: Problems of electricity quality caused by public power-supply facilities shall be solved without delay.
sentences.chinese: 对公用供电设施引起的供电质量问题，应当及时处理。

sentences.english: Inventory visibility also helps to operationally plan staffing and disposition opportunities in a timely manner.
sentences.chinese: 库存可见性还会有助于计划和处理的及时处理。

sentences.english: Don’t worry, everything will be attended to in good time!
sentences.chinese: 别着急，每件事都会得到及时处理。

sentences.english: But if not addressed, then this condition will be fatal.
sentences.chinese: 若没有及时处理，这种情形是致命的。

sentences.english: Conclusion The ESR sample should be dealed in time for veracity.
sentences.chinese: 结论血沉标本应及时处理以免引起结果的不准确。

sentences.english: Press formulary rate drive a vehicle, encounter abrupt case, can handle in time.
sentences.chinese: 按规定速度行车，碰到忽然的情况，就能够及时处理。

definition: to handle/to treat/to deal with/to process/to deal with a criminal case/to mete out punishment/to offer for sale at a reduced price/to punish
see 防患未然[fang2 huan4 wei4 ran2]
in the first moments (of sth happening)/immediately (after an event)/first thing
at the earliest possible time/as soon as possible
at set dates/at regular intervals/periodic/limited to a fixed period of time/fixed term
as quickly as possible/as soon as possible/with all speed
